title: Sound Opinions Show
teaser: The Sound Opinions World Tour treks on as we explore the rich musical heritage of Cuba with author and musician Ned Sublette. Then hosts Jim DeRogatis and Greg Kot review the posthumous new release from gospel icon Pops Staples.
description:
ANNOUNCER COPY: Coming up…The Sound Opinions World Tour heads to Cuba. As relations with Cuba begin to thaw, Jim and Greg explore the country’s rich musical heritage. Plus, they review the last recording from gospel icon Pops Staples.  
NEWS:
Hosts Jim DeRogatis and Greg Kot remember Lesley Gore, who died Monday at age 68.  The singer is best known for her work as a teen in the 1960’s with hits like “Judy's Turn to Cry” and “You Don't Own Me.”
FEATURE:
Now that it’s easier to travel to Cuba, Jim and Greg take a virtual trip to the island nation with Ned Sublette composer, musician, producer and musicologist Ned Sublette as their guide. Sublette is the author of Cuba and Its Music: From the First Drums to the Mambo. He argues that Cuban music has had more influence on other music forms than that of any other South American country.
REVIEW:
Jim and Greg review Don’t Lose This, the posthumous release from Staples Singer patriarch Pops Staples. The songs on this Jeff Tweedy-produced album were recorded in 2000, months before the gospel icon’s death.
YOUR SOUND OPINIONS:
At the end of the show we hear comments from listeners.
